oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Robert Armstrong
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside. SAVED! All the tedious and tiresome labor of BURRING & PICKING YOUR WOOL BY HAND. Robert Armstrong. No date. Press and Herald Print.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wool; Machinery; Ephemera; Broadsides;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: SAVED! All the tedious and tiresome labor of BURRING & PICKING YOUR WOOL BY HAND. I have used the Burring Machine for one season, and find that it will clean Wool from all BURRS, STICKS, TRASH, DYE CHIPS, &c., more thoroughly, and with less waste or injury than if picked by hand, for which work I CHARGE NOTHING. My Carding Machine is in thorough repair, and partly clothed with NEW CARDS. Wash your wool thoroughly, grease it well, and send it along and I will guarantee you get the best of rolls. I will receive wool and return it every week, from May 30th, to Nov. 30th, without extra charge, at the following places: McMullen & Craig, Grocery Merchants, Opera House Cor- net, Knoxville, Tenn. Mann & Co., dealers in Dry Goods and Groceries, East side Market Square, Knoxville, Armstrong's Ferry, Holston River. TERMS, 8 1/3 CTS. PER POUND FOR PLAIN, AND 1 1/2J CTS. FOR MIXED WOOL. PAYMENT REQUIRED ON DELIVERY. My Machine is located 6 miles East of Knoxville, on the E. T., Va. & Ga. R. R. Give me a trial and be convinced for yourself. ROBERT ARMSTRONG. Press and Herald Print
